answers.answer: With my first pregnancy I had this same issue.  I never developed preeclampsia, thank goodness, and actually went past my due date.  Try to take it easy as often as possible, put your feet up (elevate them), do some breathing to calm yourself.  But again, I never developed preeclampsia.  If you do, you are far enough along, they'll deliver your baby safely.I did end up in the hospital extra time because my BP spiked upon delivery and took a couple of days to go back down.  I wore a cuff 24 hours that went off every 2 hours squeezing my arm and taking my blood pressure.  Nothing like waking to ThAT in the middle of the night.But baby was fine and I ultimately was fine.  Am fine.  :>)  good luck and hang in there.

question: I'm 35 weeks today and had to go to the hospital for high blood pressure now I have to go twice a week I don't know how to not stress about it
title: high blood pressure
